comments:
After deleting a project, the feature editor stuck around (displaying the text "Unable to open editor: 'feature.xml' of project 'test.feature' is not available.)

I did not notice it was one of the back ground editors.  When I closed my current editor, the deleted feature editor took focus and I got the following NPE.

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.feature.FeatureOutlinePage$ContentProvider.getChildren(FeatureOutlinePage.java:41)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.FormOutlinePage$BasicContentProvider.hasChildren(FormOutlinePage.java:57)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.isExpandable(AbstractTreeViewer.java:2032)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeViewer.isExpandable(TreeViewer.java:575)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.isExpandable(AbstractTreeViewer.java:2058)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.updatePlus(AbstractTreeViewer.java:2682)
This one is a little too easy even for bugday, so I am just going to take the 2 seconds and fix it.
added null check.  This should prevent the NPE and have the Outline display the Missing Resource Outline Page.
